
# Collaborating on GitHub

## Prerequisites

- [Have an understanding of why Github is useful](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github/why-github.html)
- [Have a GitHub account](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github)
- [Create a repository on Github](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github)
- [Set up a Git Client](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github)
- Know how to make a pull request - [Beginner method](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github) or [Advanced method](https://hutchdatascience.org/dasl-snack-github)


:warning: This section is still being developed!

## Tips for collaborating through GitHub

1. Err on the side of over communicating!
2. Don't force push
3. Don't merge to main without a PR
4. Make issues. (How to make good ones)
5. How to ask for help!
6. You can close your own issues and PRs
7. Tag relevant people.
